description: Latin glomeratus, past participle of glomerare (“to glomerate”).

entries.meaning: Gathered together in a roundish mass or dense cluster; conglomerate.

verbs.description: glomerate (third-person singular simple present glomerates, present participle glomerating, simple past and past participle glomerated)

entries.meaning: To gather or wind into a ball; to collect (threads, etc.) into a spherical form or mass.
